column4: hello :) Please allow me one question. I am going to install ubuntu 11.10 (server) on an SSD drive. Is there any recomendation for the appriopriate filesystem?
thank you iceroot
SSD in a server? strange. I hope you have a platter based storage for your data
do you have a platter based drive for data storage too?
it is just for short testing and creating some ubuntu live images. I am not really going to use a server with SSD (in ling term) n
ask in #ubuntu+1 for Precise stuff
I wouldn't put swap on an SSD
If you are using it as a server, I'd install a platter based drive to store the user data, databases, mailserver database etc and have /var and swap on that
and obviously put the browser webcache in tempfs :)
I have to see how I can do it ... (put all the variable stuff in tmpfs)

do you use such configuration already? ... [23:14:17] <ActionParsnip> ironm: If you are using it as a server, I'd install a platter based drive to store the user data, databases, mailserver database etc and have /var and swap on that
that's how i'd set it up if I was setting up a sever using SSD for sure. I have a server but its al on a playyer based drive presently
http://releases.ubuntu.com/precise/ubuntu-12.04-desktop-i386.iso
they are one and the same thing
remember to MD5 test :)
thank you :) ... ironm@sid:~$ md5sum -b ubuntu-12.04-desktop-amd64.iso
I guess, that I can dd this iso to a USB stick and boot from it, right?
sure, you can use unetbootin
is it no binary-hybrid image ?
you can use dd if you want
is it a joke or is there really any possibility to open a terminal window without installing additional software?
press CTRL+ALT+T
